meanings.definition: In a manner relating to or characteristic of a ritual.
meanings.sent1: She performed the dance ritualistically, following each step precisely.
meanings.sent2: The priest lit the candles ritualistically before the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cat ritualistically knocked over the same vase every morning.
meanings.sent4: The old clock chimed ritualistically, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The students lined up ritualistically for the morning assembly, like clockwork.

meanings.definition: In a way that involves or is done as part of a ritual.
meanings.sent1: He drank his tea ritualistically, savoring each sip.
meanings.sent2: The team chanted ritualistically before the big game.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ritualistically buried acorns in the same spot every day.
meanings.sent4: The waves crashed ritualistically against the shore, a constant rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The chef stirred the pot ritualistically, adding ingredients with care.
